intro: Polemonium tricolor, commonly known as the three-color bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white, pink, and purple, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, woodland environments and prefers partial to full shade. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
